description: Updates the configuration of an existing slot type.

parameters.name: slotTypeId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the slot type to update.

parameters.name: slotTypeName
parameters.description: The new name of the slot type.

parameters.name: slotTypeValues
parameters.description: A new list of values and their optional synonyms that define the values that the slot type can take. (dict) --- Each slot type can have a set of values. Each SlotTypeValue represents a value that the slot type can take. sampleValue (dict) --- The value of the slot type entry. The value that can be used for a slot type. synonyms (list) --- Additional values related to the slot type entry. (dict) --- Defines one of the values for a slot type. The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_params.name: sampleValue
nested_params.description: The value of the slot type entry.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_params.name: synonyms
nested_params.description: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

parameters.name: valueSelectionSetting
parameters.description: The strategy that Amazon Lex should use when deciding on a value from the list of slot type values. Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values: ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value. TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned. If you don't specify the valueSelectionStrategy, the default is ORIGINAL_VALUE. regexFilter (dict) --- A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot. A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot. Use a standard regular expression. Amazon Lex supports the following characters in the regular expression: A-Z, a-z 0-9 Unicode characters ('- u<Unicode>') Represent Unicode characters with four digits, for example '- u0041' or '- u005A'. The following regular expression operators are not supported: Infinite repeaters: *, +, or {x,} with no upper bound. Wild card (.) advancedRecognitionSetting (dict) --- Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values. You can use this to enable using slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances. audioRecognitionStrategy (string) --- Enables using the slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

nested_params.name: resolutionStrategy
nested_params.description: Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values:

nested_params.name: regexFilter
nested_params.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

nested_params.name: pattern
nested_params.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot. Use a standard regular expression. Amazon Lex supports the following characters in the regular expression:

nested_params.name: advancedRecognitionSetting
nested_params.description: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values. You can use this to enable using slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

nested_params.name: audioRecognitionStrategy
nested_params.description: Enables using the slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bot that contains the slot type.

parameters.name: botVersion
parameters.description: The version of the bot that contains the slot type. Must be DRAFT.

parameters.name: localeId
parameters.description: The identifier of the language and locale that contains the slot type. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

parameters.name: externalSourceSetting
parameters.description: Provides information about the external source of the slot type's definition. grammarSlotTypeSetting (dict) --- Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide. source (dict) --- The source of the grammar used to create the slot type. The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the grammar source. The path to the grammar in the Amazon S3 bucket. kmsKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

nested_params.name: grammarSlotTypeSetting
nested_params.description: Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide.

nested_params.name: source
nested_params.description: The source of the grammar used to create the slot type.

nested_params.name: s3BucketName
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

nested_params.name: s3ObjectKey
nested_params.description: The path to the grammar in the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

parameters.name: compositeSlotTypeSetting
parameters.description: Specifications for a composite slot type. subSlots (list) --- Subslots in the composite slot. (dict) --- Subslot type composition. Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot. The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot.

nested_params.description: The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.

nested_items.name: resolutionStrategy
nested_items.description: Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values:
ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.
TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned.
